item.title: Dissertation
item.description: Title: Investigating the effectiveness of major Internet protocols in addressing DNS privacy concerns. In this paper I investigate a recent and ongoing problem of DNS privacy. The paper covers in depth analysis of the current issue with DNS privacy, why it is a problem and what the community has proposed to address this issue. As the investigation progresses I explain the underlying technologies that the proposed solutions contain and critically analyse and compare their performances using established machine learning methods.

item.title: #01 Dethroning TCP in the Web
item.description: Latest Revision: 03/09/2022 prerequisites The reader should have some understanding of basic networking concepts such as the OSI protocol layers, how the web and in particular HTTP works. Abstract Ever since Tim Burners-Lee created the World Wide Web, TCP has been the main and in most cases the only option providing reliable transport to web exchanges. Understandably, TCP was the obvious option since web exchanges required reliability to exchange web content.

item.title: About me
item.description: My name is Ahmed Al-Jabri, I’m a recent BSc graduate from Aston University for Cybersecurity. My core interests revolve around Computer Network Protocols, Distributed Systems and Secure Programming.The title Thoughful Voyage mirrors the purpose of this blog which is to share reflective inquiries, deep insights and analysis on various topics of interest that I come across in my learning journey. Note: The opinions put forward in this site are my own and do not represent any of the organisations I work for.
